title: Includes bias-related graffiti in crime of aggravated harassment in the first degree
summary: Includes bias-related graffiti in crime of aggravated harassment in the first degree; makes provisions authorizing the court in sentencing a person for bias-related graffiti to participate in a diversity training program and/or to suspend the driving license of such person; makes related provisions.

       Introduced by Sens. OPPENHEIMER, DIAZ, PARKER, SAMPSON -- read twice and

       AN ACT to amend the penal law  and  the  vehicle  and  traffic  law,  in
         relation to bias-related graffiti

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 240.31 of the penal law is amended by adding a  new
    2  subdivision 1-a to read as follows:
    3    1-A.  ETCHES,  PAINTS,  COVERS,  DRAWS UPON OR OTHERWISE PLACES A MARK
    4  UPON PUBLIC OR PRIVATE PROPERTY; OR
    5    S 2. The penal law is amended by adding a new section 60.31 to read as
    6  follows:
    7  S 60.31 AUTHORIZED  DISPOSITION;  AGGRAVATED  HARASSMENT  IN  THE  FIRST
    8              DEGREE.
    9    WHEN  A PERSON IS CONVICTED OF AN OFFENSE DEFINED IN SUBDIVISION ONE-A
   10  OF SECTION 240.31 OF THIS CHAPTER, OR OF AN ATTEMPT TO  COMMIT  SUCH  AN
   11  OFFENSE,  OR  OF  A  LESSER  INCLUDED  OFFENSE, IN ADDITION TO ANY OTHER
   12  SENTENCE  IMPOSED  OR  AS  A  CONDITION  OF  PROBATION  OR   CONDITIONAL
   13  DISCHARGE: (1) THE COURT MAY ORDER SUCH PERSON TO PARTICIPATE IN, AT HIS
   14  OWN  EXPENSE,  A DIVERSITY TRAINING PROGRAM THAT IS DESIGNED TO OVERCOME
   15  DISCRIMINATION, PREJUDICE AND INTOLERANCE, AND  THAT  PROMOTES  COMMUNI-
   16  CATION,  UNDERSTANDING  AND  RESPECT AMONG DIVERSE RACIAL, RELIGIOUS AND
   17  ETHNIC GROUPS AND/OR (2) MAY SUSPEND SUCH INDIVIDUAL'S DRIVER'S  LICENSE
   18  OR  PRIVILEGE TO DRIVE IN THIS STATE FOR A PERIOD OF UP TO ONE YEAR, OR,
   19  IN THE EVENT SUCH INDIVIDUAL DOES NOT HAVE A DRIVER'S LICENSE, THE COURT
   20  MAY DELAY THE GRANTING OF A DRIVER'S LICENSE FOR A PERIOD OF UP  TO  ONE
   21  YEAR.
   22    S 3. Section 502 of the vehicle and traffic law is amended by adding a
   23  new subdivision 8 to read as follows:

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06223-01-1

       S. 1842                             2

    1    8.  EXCEPTIONS.  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THIS SECTION,
    2  THE COMMISSIONER SHALL NOT  ISSUE  A  DRIVER'S  LICENSE  TO  ANY  PERSON
    3  CONVICTED  OF  AN OFFENSE DEFINED IN SUBDIVISION ONE-A OF SECTION 240.31
    4  OF THE PENAL LAW, OR OF AN ATTEMPT TO COMMIT SUCH AN OFFENSE,  OR  OF  A
    5  LESSER  INCLUDED  OFFENSE,  UNTIL SUCH TIME AS IMPOSED BY THE SENTENCING
    6  COURT HAS LAPSED.
    7    S 4. Subdivision 3 of section 510 of the vehicle and  traffic  law  is
    8  amended by adding a new paragraph j-1 to read as follows:
    9    J-1.  FOR  A PERIOD UP TO ONE YEAR WHERE THE HOLDER HAS BEEN CONVICTED
   10  OF AN OFFENSE DEFINED IN SUBDIVISION ONE-A  OF  SECTION  240.31  OF  THE
   11  PENAL LAW;
   12    S 5. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   13  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law and the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to bias-related graffiti
